title: 820-4924-a no power
820-4924-a no power
message:
Do you have 3V3_S5/SUS?
Post PM_PWRBTN_L, PM_RSMRST_L, PM_BATLOW_L, PM_DSW_PWRGD, PCH_DSWVRMEN.
Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L.

title: 820-4924-a no power
message:
PP3V3_S5 3.35V; PP3V3_SUS 3.35V ;PM_PWRBTN_L 3.42V; PM_RSMRST_L 3.18V; PM_BATLOW_L 0.03V;  PM_DSW_PWRGD  3.43V; PCH_DSWVRMEN 2.9V;
THERE WAS NO VOLTAGE DROP IN PM_PWRBTN_L GIVING A PULSE IN SMC_ONOFF_L.

title: 820-4924-a no power
message:
"PM_BATLOW_L 0.03V"
Do you have original Magsafe 2 60/85W charger?

Please, do not use capital letters in excess...

title: 820-4924-a no power
message: using original 85W chargers, test 3 chargers and continue the same voltage PM_BATLOW_L / R1410 0.03V

title: 820-4924-a no power
message:
Does it charge the battery?
Also trigger SMC_ONOFF_L when battery connected.

Check all RTC signals...

title: 820-4924-a no power
message:
com a bateria conectada, havia tensão na malha PM_BATLOW_L 3.32V.

RTC: RTC_RESET_L 3,34V; PPVOUT_S0_PCH_DCPRTC 1,69V; PPVRTC_G3H 3,35V; PCH_CLK32K_RTCX1 0,50V; PCH_SRTCRST_L 3,34V;
Eu acho que esses são os sinais do RTC.

the machine turned on with the battery connected unexpectedly, but only with the battery plugged in.

title: 820-4924-a no power
message: Check the charger type reported by macOS in System Report...

title: 820-4924-a no power

It takes time to climb the macOS, accelerated cooler and in the sistem report says that the charger is original. 
I used another battery to raise the macOS, because the client's doesn't do that.

title: 820-4924-a no power
message:
Does it work correctly with battery connected?
Battery is charging?

title: 820-4924-a no power
message: charging, charging up, but the mac is very slow and with the cooler accelerated

title: 820-4924-a no power
message:
Try disconnecting webcam.
Also try another trackpad board/flex.

Run HWMonitor and see the temps and current sensors.

title: 820-4924-a no power
message: sorry, I didn't understand how you do it "Run HWMonitor and see the temperatures and current sensors."

title: 820-4924-a no power
message: you shouldn't connect without a battery ? the battery signal appears receiving charge.

title: 820-4924-a no power
message:
Connect the battery, if the board doesn't start other way.

Once logged into macOS, dowsnload and install HWMonitor.
Then run it and check temp values and current sensors.

title: 820-4924-a no power
message: friend, you would have the link to download this software because I only find DEMO and this one does not make available all the sensors, it follows in annex the image of the sensors.

title: 820-4924-a no power
message: Disconnect webcam and try again...

title: 820-4924-a no power
message: solved the slowness of the machine with the webcam disconnected and with another battery. And the question of running without battery ?

title: 820-4924-a no power
message:
Maybe this board doesn't want to start without battery.
I know some MacBooks have such behaviour...

Board still slow with battery and webcam connected?
Same camera error reported in diagnistic start up?
In such case, cut off the traces from pins 8/9 of J4002 and try again.
Usually is ALS failure; you could be able to use webcam...

title: 820-4924-a no power
message: resolved with the camera disconnected, I normalize.

title: 820-4924-a no power
message: You may be able to use webcam, disconnecting only ALS lines; not sure, but worth to try...
